name: Key Finders
overview: In the game Keyfinders you have to explore a maze. Obviously, this was done with rather malicious intent and by a very self-centered person. Because there is no doubt that the facility was built to get lost in it and to perish in agony. In a creative way, there are not four differently colored ghosts cavorting in this maze, but space shuttles, jumping balls, spiders, small robots and bats. Of course, everything is also riddled with traps - so variety is provided. Instead of staying away from all of this, the hero whose role we put ourselves in the game is now stuck in this very maze. His name is Nebraska Joe - and any resemblance to the most famous archaeologist in film history is surely just a stupid coincidence. His job is no easier, however, by hopping, climbing ladders, and collecting keys and equipment, he works his way bravely through the hostile environment. There are four levels to master and to reach the exit of the labyrinth - in the best case, alive ... Published in Magic Disk 64 1990/03
